page.title: 02The Village Government.
page.content: The villages of the area are governed by each local Parish Council. The Parish Council is made up of councillors whose number depends on the population of the village.The councillors are elected by the people of the village. To be a Parish Councillor you need to be proposed by two people of the village.If you are well known you are likely to get more votes.You are not allowed to bribe them, buy them drinks, give them money or threaten people.You have to live in the area. There are Parish Council elections every four years. The Parish Council look after the village's land and affairs.They also see its facilities are used correctly. For example,the Waltham Parish Council maintain the village green,Grove Park, allotments,the Cemetery and Cenotaph.
